item.title: Trip hazard: dangerously raised paving slab St Paul’s Road, 26th October
item.description:
On the pavement outside the School House cafe on St Paul’s Road. One of the pavement slabs is raised by over an inch creating a trip hazard. There are white numbers painted on th slabs. Possibly this is highways planned work or could be a utility company

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage ditch opposite Sarnia is completely blocked and totally overgrown. Land owner has moved out of the area and has failed to clear the ditch and maintain hedgerow for several years. Vegetation now covers tarmac by more than 0.5m, 26th October
item.description:
Opposite Sarnia, Butts Lane. 40m stretch completely blocked. Including across gateway to field and footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butt's Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree at front of 58 Moorend Park Road, 25th October
item.description:
Hi I have spoken with Gloucestershire County Council and they have stated to raise a ticket to carry out a side prune. Please can this be carried out. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Moorend Park Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive and numerous potholes spread across the entire road, 25th October
item.description:
The road is the High Street and the issues stretches all the way from the mini roundabout with Noverton Lane to the junction with The Bank. This whole stretch of road needs digging up and resurfacing as at the moment it resembles a patchwork quilt of botchery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Closed Due To Floods Sign Obscured/Wrong Location, 25th October
item.description:
This Sign is often obscured by parked vehicles on the property owners drive & is also obscured by vegetation. It is often missed/ignored by traffic who then find that after travelling quite a distance to around The Red Lion Inn area encounter the flooding & have to do a U turn & return back to the A38. Others have continued along the flooded Lane thinking the flood water depth remains at a constant depth. Then suddenly find themselves in up to 4-5ft of water. The solution would be to move the sign some 5-10 meters along the Lane from the junction so it is more visible to motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
